case_title: Messrs Millenium Franchises vs Commissioner (Appeals) PRA, LHR

accussed_details.name: Messrs Millenium Franchises
allegation: Evasion of sales tax amounting to Rs.16,430,877/-

complaint_summary: The appellant was accused of concealing true sales information as a franchisee of Subway International BV, resulting in tax fraud and evasion of sales tax amounting to Rs.16,430,877/-.
investigation_summary: The Additional Commissioner, Enforcement-I of PRA issued a show-cause notice on 28.12.2018 alleging violations of Sections 2(43), 3, 10, 11, 18, and 35 of PSTSA 2012. Sales tax returns and information provided by the franchiser were used as evidence.
judgment_summary: The tribunal dismissed the appeal, upholding the orders of the Commissioner (Appeals) and the assessing officer. The appellant's conduct was deemed evasive, and no irregularities were found in the impugned orders.
punishment: Liable for evasion of sales tax amounting to Rs.16,430,877/- along with default surcharge and penalty of the same amount.
legal_arguments: Appellant argued the SCN calculations were incorrect and illegal.
Appellant claimed insufficient opportunities for defense.
Appellant contended the penalty was harsh and the SCN lacked specific subsections/clauses.
Prosecution argued appellant failed to defend the case and continuously sought adjournments.

legal_terms.Show-Cause Notice (SCN): A legal notice requiring a party to explain or justify their actions.
legal_terms.Default Surcharge: A penalty for late payment of taxes.

words_and_phrases.Tax fraud: Deliberate falsification or concealment of financial information to evade taxes.
words_and_phrases.Evasive conduct: Behavior aimed at avoiding legal obligations or proceedings.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around allegations of tax fraud and evasion by Messrs Millenium Franchises, a franchisee of Subway International BV. The appellant failed to defend the case adequately, leading to dismissal of the appeal and imposition of penalties.
